docs.title: Mermaid Chart Documentation
docs.subtitle: Quickly learn how to create various diagrams using Mermaid syntax
docs.resourcesDesc: This page provides basic Mermaid syntax guidelines. For more advanced features and detailed syntax, please refer to:

flowchart.syntax1: graph TD - defines a top-down graph (TD = Top Down)

sequence.syntax3: A->>B: Text - creates a solid arrow for synchronous messages
sequence.syntax4: A-->>B: Text - creates a dashed arrow for return/asynchronous messages

class.syntax2: class ClassName {} - defines a class with properties/methods
class.syntax5: A <|-- B - indicates B inherits from A (B is a subclass of A)

state.syntax2: [*] - represents the start or end state
state.syntax3: A --> B - creates a transition from A to B
state.syntax4: A --> B: Text - creates a labeled transition

entity.syntax1: erDiagram - defines an entity relationship diagram

gantt.syntax2: title Title - sets the chart title
gantt.syntax3: dateFormat Format - sets the date format
gantt.syntax4: section Name - defines a project section
gantt.syntax5: Task Name: ID, Start Date, Duration/End Date
gantt.syntax7: after ID - indicates after another task

pie.syntax2: title Title - sets the pie chart title
pie.syntax3: "Label" : Value - defines a slice of the pie chart
